title._content: ["Brookside," William Hall Walker house, Brookside Road, Great Barrington, Massachusetts. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. ["Brookside," William Hall Walker house, Brookside Road, Great Barrington, Massachusetts. Perennial garden casino] [ca. 1916] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House Architecture: Carrère & Hastings, 1910 with 1912 alterations and additions for William Hall Walker. Landscape: Garden casino and garden by Ferruccio Vitale, 1912-1918. Associated Name: Carrie Jones (Mrs. William H.) Walker. Today: House and remaining grounds now Eisner camp for children sponsored by the Reform Movement in Judaism. Photographed when Frances Benjamin Johnston and Mattie Edwards Hewitt worked together. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Subjects: Landscape pavilions--Massachusetts--Great Barrington--1910-1920. Gardens--Massachusetts--Great Barrington--1910-1920. Sculpture--Massachusetts--Great Barrington--1910-1920. Flowers--Massachusetts--Great Barrington--1910-1920. Format: Lantern slides--Hand-colored--1910-1920. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16287 Call Number: LC-J717-X100- 78
